name: Diode Computers, Inc.
headline: Automate circuit board design using AI
description: Diode automates hardware design, like hiring a senior electronic engineer for your projects. We use generative AI models to create and manufacture custom printed circuit boards in minutes, not weeks.

founders.name: Davide Asnaghi, Founder
founders.description:
Davide is the Co-Founder and CEO @ Diode Computers, Inc.

- 6 Years of experience building hardware at big tech (Special Projects Group @ Apple working on robotics) and medtech startups (Butterfly Network, Chromatic).

- B.Sc. Engineering and Robotics, doing research in Hong Kong and Shenzhen, hardware capital of the world

- M.Eng. At Berkeley: designed open source hand prosthesis hardware

founders.name: Lenny Khazan, Founder
founders.description: Lenny is the Co-Founder and CTO @ Diode Computers, Inc.

# Ship Hardware. Fast.
Automate circuit board manufacturing, from design to delivery.
[Start Designing](https://diode.computer/<https:/pcb.new/>)
![](https://framerusercontent.com/images/tfV29bOze7p0PPlWu3z4V5Pv7A.png?scale-down-to=2048)
![](https://framerusercontent.com/images/tfV29bOze7p0PPlWu3z4V5Pv7A.png?scale-down-to=2048)
![](https://framerusercontent.com/images/Ce3knc6w2JzwZVmO6PnbL2kAeoc.png?scale-down-to=2048)
### Our team shipped serious hardware
We are bringing you the tool we wish we had.
### Build with Diode
Diode offers an opinionated new way to build circuit boards. Here's how we do it.
##### Design boards with code
We integrate with open source schematics-as-code tools like atopile, and provide tooling and modules that help you get from design to delivery in days.
##### Route and order in seconds
No need to perform tedious manual routing and BOM matching. Now you can automatically route and order your boards with ease.
##### Generate components with AI
Sick of reading datasheets and copying reference layouts? Let our agent generate them for you, reviewed by an electrical engineer for accuracy.
Engineered for Intelligence
### A new hardware development stack.For humans **and** machines.
### A new hardware development stack.For humans **and** machines.
### A new hardware development stack.For humans **and** machines.
##### Command line workflow
##### Command lineworkflow
Built from the ground up for software and firmware engineers, and AI agents.

generated_description:
**Diode Computers, Inc.** is a fresh entrant in the tech scene, founded in 2024, and currently part of Y Combinator's Batch S24. Located in New York, this two-person startup has a compelling mission: to automate circuit board design using AI. Think of it as hiring a senior electronic engineer—but faster and more efficiently.

Diode streamlines the hardware design process by leveraging generative AI. The idea is simple yet powerful: instead of the typical weeks-long process to develop custom printed circuit boards (PCBs), they promise to deliver these in minutes. Their platform integrates with open-source design tools and sets itself apart by allowing users to design boards with code, automate routing, and generate component layouts—all reviewed for accuracy by an electrical engineer. This innovative approach transforms a traditionally tedious task into a sleek command-line workflow.

Their offerings cater to various users, from hobbyists to enterprises. They provide a free plan to test the waters with basic features, an Enterprise plan for serious developers needing robust routing and discounts, and a Full-Service option that includes personalized support. This scaling strategy reflects an understanding of customer needs at different levels of engagement.

Backing from Y Combinator not only provides credibility but also highlights their potential for growth. Led by Diana Hu as their Group Partner, Diode is well-positioned to tap into the surge of interest in generative AI, particularly within the manufacturing and electronics sectors.

In summary, Diode Computers is on a mission to dramatically simplify hardware design, making it accessible, efficient, and fast—a welcome innovation in a corner of tech that has often lagged behind. If you're interested in designing circuit boards quicker than ever before, take a look at their [website](https://diode.computer).
